title: (x) L'actualité masthead and cover type - (similar to) Helvetica Comp, Agenda {Tim D, Yves}
content:
Hey all, I’m trying to identify the typeface used for the nameplate over at [www.lactualite.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20051123011701/http:/www.lactualite.com/). If anyone can help me out, it’d be much appreciated. Thanks!

EDIT: While we’re at it, I’m also trying to identify the other typeface(s) used on their magazine covers. [https://www.rogersmagazines.com/images/act/images/ACT\_covers\_manger\_memoire.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20051123011701/https:/www.rogersmagazines.com/images/act/images/ACT_covers_manger_memoire.JPG)
author: nsutanto

comments.content:
I think L’actualité is Helvetica compressed slightly redrawn.  
Futura Condensed on the cover Le Bonheur est dans la Maison.  
Tim

The geometric sans on the covers is not Fartura but most likely [Edward Johnston](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Edward%20Johnston)’s far more beautiful and elegant [Agenda](http://web.archive.org/web/20051123011701/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=agenda), as gigitised by [The Font Bureau](http://web.archive.org/wiki/The%20Font%20Bureau), Inc.
